page.title: 05FARMING: NATEBY & WHARTON
page.content: THE TOTAL NUMBER OF FARMS IS TWELVE, VARYING IN SIZE FROM 30 TO 700 ACRES. OVER THE LAST DECADE 4 FARMS HAVE BEEN ABSORBED BY OTHERS TO INCREASE THEIR ACREAGE.ALL ARE UPLAND FARMS WITH FELL GRAZING RIGHTS AND ARE OWNER OCCUPIED, EXCEPTING 4, WHICH ARE TENANTED. THERE ARE 13 EMPLOYEES ON THESE FARMS, 4 OF THEM BEING SONS OF THE FARMERS. IT IS ENTIRELY A GRASSLAND DISTRICT WITH OPEN FELLS, HEATHER ALLOTMENTS, PASTURES AND MEADOWLAND. ALL FARMS MAKE HAY AND SOME MAKE SILAGE. ALL FARMS SPECIALIZE IN SHEEP PRODUCTION, WITH NATEBY PARISH HAVING ONLY THE SWALEDALE BREED,BUT WHARTON HAVING SWALEDALE AND ROUGH FELL EWES.THREE FARMS HAVE DAIRYING AS AN IMPORTANT ENTERPRISE AND OTHERS HAVE BEEF CATTLE PRODUCING SUCKLED CALVES.SOME WHARTON FARMERS BREED FELL PONIES.
